'''Eugenia "Juna" Yuvashevna Davitashvili '''(Georgian:ááááááá ''á¯á£áá'' ááááááá¨áááá)(b. 22 July 1949 in [[Urmia, Krasnodar|Urmia]], [[Krasnodar]]) is a [[Russians|Russian]] [[faith healer]] of Assyrian<ref>Ð¯ Ð¸Ð· Ð³Ð»ÑÐ±Ð¾ÐºÐ¾Ð¹ Ð¿ÑÐ¾Ð²Ð¸Ð½ÑÐ¸Ð¸, Ð¸Ð· ÑÑÐ°Ð½Ð¸ÑÑ "ÐÑÑÐ¸ÑÐ¸Ð¹ÐºÐ° Ð½Ð° ÐÑÐ±Ð°Ð½Ð¸" [http://bibliotekar.ru/encKat/3-26.htm] [http://www.c-cafe.ru/days/bio/23/024_23.php]</ref> descent who claims the power to cure [[cancer]], knit broken bodies, and prolong life beyond 100 years.<ref name="MWJournal">{{cite news|url=http://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1499&dat=19820424&id=GFIaAAAAIBAJ&sjid=1SkEAAAAIBAJ&pg=2555,2272899|title=Even Russia Turns Up A Faith Healer|date=April 24, 1982|publisher=The Milwaukee Journal |accessdate=27 January 2010}}</ref>
== Politics ==
In 1995, she participated in the [[Russian legislative election, 1995|Russian legislative election]] at the head of the Juna Davitashvili Bloc. Her 0.47 % of votes were not enough to give her any seat in the [[State Duma]].
== Experiments ==
In 1983 and 1984, [[Physicist]] and psi researcher, [[Russell Targ]], his daughter [[Elisabeth Targ]], and Keith Harary visited the [[Soviet Union]] as guests of the [[Soviet Academy of Sciences]]. In Moscow they were able to discuss remote viewing research with Russian scientists, visit with psychic and carry out some remote viewing experiments between [[Moscow]] and [[San Francisco]].<ref name="targ"> {{cite journal |last1= Anderson |first1= Ian |date= 22 November 1984 |title= Strange case of the psychic 'spy' |journal= New Scientist |volume= |issue= 1431 |pages= 3â4 |publisher= |doi= |url= http://books.google.com/books?id=bfl5gPwcMsIC&pg=PA3 |accessdate= 16 January 2011 }} </ref><ref> {{cite book |title= The mind race: understanding and using psychic abilities |last1= Targ |first1= Russell |last2= Harary |first2= Keith |authorlink= |year= 1984 |publisher= Villard Books |location= New York |isbn= 9780394533568 |page= |pages= |url= |accessdate= }} </ref>
